Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech or trace the etymology of words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word's position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Spell correctly.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Plan and present an argument that: supports a claim, acknowledges counterarguments, organizes evidence logically, uses words and phrases to create cohesion, and provides a concluding statement that supports the argument presented.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present claims and findings (e.g., argument, narrative, summary presentations), emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, and attitude toward the subject, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others' questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)
